description: This JavaScript source file defines and implements several public modules for focus management, action routing, and user feedback in a smart TV application. It includes modules FocusManager, AppRouter, and Toast, which handle keyboard navigation, action dispatching, and toast notifications respectively.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.description: Sets focus on a specified DOM element, updating visual classes and calling focus() if available.

methods.name: getAllFocusable
methods.description: Retrieves all focusable DOM elements within the container, filtering out disabled or hidden elements.

methods.name: move
methods.description: Moves focus in a specified direction ('left', 'right', 'up', 'down') to the most appropriate focusable element.

methods.name: activate
methods.description: Activates the currently focused element, triggering associated action or click event.

methods.name: onKey
methods.description: Handles key events for navigation and actions, mapping keys to movement, activation, or navigation back.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the FocusManager with optional container and initial focus element.

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers a new action handler in AppRouter by name.

methods.name: trigger
methods.description: Triggers an action registered in AppRouter by name, passing in an element if necessary.

methods.name: back
methods.description: Navigates back in history or redirects to 'home.html' if no referrer.

methods.name: show
methods.description: Displays a toast message temporarily on screen.
